psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 19,8]]The law of the LORD is perfect, 
refreshing the soul; 
The decree of the LORD is trustworthy, 
giving wisdom to the simple.

[[Ps 19,9]]The precepts of the LORD are right,
rejoicing the heart; 
The command of the LORD is clear, 
enlightening the eye.  

[[Ps 19,10]]The fear of the LORD is pure, 
enduring forever; 
The ordinances of the LORD are true, 
all of them just.

[[Ps 19,15]]Let the words of my mouth and the thought of my heart 
find favor before you, 
O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 2,13]]Jesus went out along the sea. All the crowd came to him and he taught them.
[[Mc 2,14]]As he passed by, he saw Levi, son of Alphaeus, sitting at the customs post. He said to him, "Follow me." And he got up and followed him.
[[Mc 2,15]]While he was at table in his house, many tax collectors and sinners sat with Jesus and his disciples; for there were many who followed him.
[[Mc 2,16]]Some scribes who were Pharisees saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors and said to his disciples, "Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?"
[[Mc 2,17]]Jesus heard this and said to them (that), "Those who are well do not need a physician, but the sick do. I did not come to call the righteous but sinners."

first_reading.title: Letter to the Hebrews
first_reading.text:
[[He 4,12]]The word of God is living and effective, sharper than any two-edged sword, penetrating even between soul and spirit, joints and marrow, and able to discern reflections and thoughts of the heart.
[[He 4,13]]No creature is concealed from him, but everything is naked and exposed to the eyes of him to whom we must render an account.
[[He 4,14]]Therefore, since we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold fast to our confession.
[[He 4,15]]For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but one who has similarly been tested in every way, yet without sin.
[[He 4,16]]So let us confidently approach the throne of grace to receive mercy and to find grace for timely help.
